title: Arts & Entertainment
description: Learn vocabulary for discussing art, music, film, literature, and cultural events.

words.meaning: an outstanding work of art
words.example: The painting is considered a masterpiece of Renaissance art.

words.meaning: a category of art or literature
words.example: Science fiction is my favorite film genre.

words.meaning: a public display of art or objects
words.example: The museum is hosting an exhibition of modern sculptures.

words.meaning: an act of presenting entertainment
words.example: The orchestra gave a stunning performance last night.

words.meaning: a person who writes music
words.example: Beethoven is one of the greatest composers in history.

words.meaning: a person who writes plays
words.example: Shakespeare is the most famous playwright in English literature.

words.meaning: a three-dimensional work of art
words.example: The sculpture was carved from a single block of marble.

words.meaning: a painting or photograph of a person
words.example: The artist painted a beautiful portrait of the queen.

words.meaning: belonging to the present time
words.example: The gallery specializes in contemporary art.

words.meaning: not representing reality directly
words.example: Abstract art often focuses on shapes and colors rather than objects.

words.meaning: having great influence on others
words.example: Picasso was one of the most influential artists of the 20th century.

words.meaning: attracting and holding attention
words.example: The film had a captivating storyline.

words.meaning: bringing strong feelings or memories to mind
words.example: The music was evocative of summer days.

words.meaning: highly praised by critics
words.example: The film was critically acclaimed but failed at the box office.

words.meaning: a highly successful and popular production
words.example: The movie became the summer's biggest blockbuster.

words.meaning: the first public performance of a work
words.example: The film had its world premiere at the festival.

words.meaning: to explain the meaning of something
words.example: Critics interpret the painting as a commentary on society.

words.meaning: to represent in a picture or performance
words.example: The actor portrayed the historical figure brilliantly.

words.meaning: to fill with creative or emotional motivation
words.example: The landscape inspired many of her paintings.

words.meaning: to show or represent in a picture or words
words.example: The novel depicts life in rural Japan.

words.meaning: to practice for a public performance
words.example: The cast rehearsed the play for weeks before opening night.

words.meaning: a detailed analysis and assessment
words.example: The professor wrote a critique of the artist's work.

words.meaning: relating to beauty or artistic taste
words.example: The building has great aesthetic appeal.

words.meaning: the music accompanying a film
words.example: The soundtrack won an award for best original score.

words.meaning: a story or account of events
words.example: The film has a complex narrative structure.

words.meaning: the use of symbols to represent ideas
words.example: The director used symbolism throughout the film.

words.meaning: new and experimental in style
words.example: The artist is known for her avant-garde approach.

words.meaning: the main character in a story
words.example: The protagonist struggles with moral dilemmas throughout the novel.

words.meaning: the art of photography and camera work in film
words.example: The cinematography was breathtaking.

words.meaning: able to adapt to many different functions
words.example: She is a versatile actress who can play any role.

exercises.instruction: Match the words with their definitions

pairs.definition: the main character in a story
the first public performance of a work

exercises.instruction: Complete the sentences with the correct words

sentences.sentence: The museum is hosting a _____ of Impressionist paintings.
The film was _____ by critics for its original storyline.
Beethoven is considered one of the greatest _____ of all time.
The painting uses _____ to represent the passage of time.

exercises.instruction: Choose the best word to complete each sentence

questions.question: The actor gave a _____ performance that moved the audience to tears.
The novel _____ life in 19th century London.
